title: ğŸ“ My Education
content: I'm a junior studying Computer Sciences and Mathematics at University of Wisconsin-Madison, located in Wisconsin, USA.

comments.content: I took Programming III, Introduction to Artificial Intelligence, Introduction to Algorithms, Database Management Systems: Design and Implementation, Machine Organization and Programming, Elementary Matrix and Linear Algebra, Introduction to Discrete Mathematics, Introduction to Probability and Mathematical Statistics I and so on.
I'm taking "Introductions to Algorithms" using Java and "Database Management Systems: Design and Implementation" using Python, SQL, and C++ for this semester.ğŸ‘
Artificial Intelligence course was the most exciting course last semester! I used pytorch, numpy, pandas, matplotlib, and many other python libraries.

title: ğŸ’» Some Projects I have made
content:
I have several projects I have made since 2022.
Some brief information about these projects will be written in the comments!

comments.content: Discrete Learners, during MadHacks Fall 2023 ğŸ§®

I designed a full-stack web application with a react front-end with styling from Tailwind CSS and a backend in Flask.
I implemented a Dockerfile so that the site could be hosted on Google Cloud and created custom problem generators in Javascript for various sections in these classes and combined them with existing problems.
I also implemented them in a database to use them as training data for a machine-learning model to generate new problems and explanations for existing problems.

I developed a specialized Java application designed to assist users in selecting movies that align with their available viewing time slots, utilizing sophisticated data structuring and algorithm implementation.
I engaged in the creation of a Java backend system that parses movie data from CSV files, inserting and organizing content by duration using a Red-Black Tree data structure, and devised interfaces and classes to reveal crucial movie attributes, enabling the frontend to conduct efficient searches and display movies fitting specified time frames.

I designed an AI player for the strategic board game Teeko, utilizing advanced AI techniques and Python programming skills.
I developed a minimax algorithm to simulate game scenarios and determine optimal moves for an AI player within a 5x5 board game, and analyzed a state representation in Python, leveraging class structures for efficient game state management and AI decision-making
